excessive_noncompete.description: Non-compete clauses are VOID in California under Bus. & Prof. Code § 16600
excessive_noncompete.recommendation: REMOVE the non-compete clause entirely. California courts will not enforce it.
legal_references: Edwards v. Arthur Andersen LLP (2008) 44 Cal.4th 937

california_meal_break.name: California Meal Break Violation
california_meal_break.description: California requires a 30-minute unpaid meal break for shifts over 5 hours
california_meal_break.recommendation: Ensure contract allows for compliant meal breaks per Cal. Lab. Code § 512
legal_references: Brinker Restaurant Corp. v. Superior Court

california_rest_break.name: California Rest Break Violation
california_rest_break.description: California requires 10-minute paid rest breaks per 4 hours worked
california_rest_break.recommendation: Ensure contract allows for compliant rest breaks

california_expense_reimbursement.name: Expense Reimbursement Required
california_expense_reimbursement.description: California requires employers to reimburse necessary business expenses
california_expense_reimbursement.recommendation: Include expense reimbursement policy per Cal. Lab. Code § 2802

california_section_1542_waiver.name: Section 1542 Waiver Required
california_section_1542_waiver.description: California releases must specifically waive Civil Code § 1542 (unknown claims)
california_section_1542_waiver.recommendation: Include explicit Section 1542 waiver language for valid release
california_section_1542_waiver.required_language: A general release does not extend to claims that the creditor or releasing party does not know or suspect to exist in his or her favor at the time of executing the release and that, if known by him or her, would have materially affected his or her settlement with the debtor or released party.

california_final_pay.name: Final Pay Timing
california_final_pay.description: California requires immediate final pay upon termination, or within 72 hours if employee quits
california_final_pay.recommendation: Ensure termination provisions comply with Cal. Lab. Code § 201-203

california_paga_waiver.name: Invalid PAGA Waiver
california_paga_waiver.description: California prohibits waiver of representative PAGA claims
california_paga_waiver.recommendation: Remove any PAGA waiver provisions - they are unenforceable
legal_references: Iskanian v. CLS Transportation Los Angeles, LLC (2014)

completeness_additions.name: Section 1542 Waiver
completeness_additions.description: Explicit waiver of unknown claims under Cal. Civ. Code § 1542

completeness_additions.name: Meal/Rest Break Policy
completeness_additions.description: Clear statement on meal and rest break entitlements
